name: $ampoule
desc: A container, typically made of glass or plastic and with a narrow neck, used for storing liquids.

name: $bottle
desc: A container with a flat base and sides, typically square or rectangular and having a lid.

name: $box
desc: A device of various configuration and composition used with a syringe for the application of anesthetic or other materials to a patient.

name: $cartridge
desc: A package intended to store pharmaceuticals.

name: $container
desc: A long, hollow cylinder of metal, plastic, glass, etc., for holding medications, typically creams or ointments

name: $tube
desc: A dose of medicine prepared in an individual package for convenience, safety or monitoring.

name: $unitdose
desc: A small container, typically cylindrical and made of glass, used especially for holding liquid medications.
